content: स्थानं [स्था-ल्युट्] {@--1@} The act of standing or remaining, stay, continuance, residence; <ls>U. 3. 32.</ls> {@--2@} Being fixed or stationary. {@--3@} A state, condition. {@--4@} A place, spot, site, locality; अक्षमालामदत्त्वास्मात्स्थानात्पदात्पदमपि न गंतव्यं <ls>K.</ls> {@--5@} Station, situation, position. {@--6@} Relation, capacity; पितृस्थाने ‘in the place or capacity of a father’; भक्ष्यस्थाने <ls>Pt. 2. 26.</ls> {@--7@} An abode, a house, dwelling-house; स एव (नक्रः) प्रच्युतः स्थानाच्छुनापि परिभूयते <ls>Pt. 3. 46.</ls> {@--8@} ({%a%}) A country, region, district. ({%b%}) A town, city. {@--9@} Office, rank, dignity; अमात्यस्थाने नियोजितः. {@--10@} Object; गुणाः पूजास्थानं गुणिषु न च लिंगं न च वयः <ls>U. 4. 11.</ls> {@--11@} An occasion, a matter, subject, cause; पराभ्यूहस्थानान्यपि तनुतराणि स्यगयति <ls>Māl. 1. 14</ls>; स्थानं जरापरिभवस्य तदेव पुंसां <ls>Subhāṣ.</ls>; so कलह°, कोप°, विवाद° &c. {@--12@} A fit or proper place; स्थानेष्वेव नियोज्यंते भृत्याश्चाभरणानि च <ls>Pt. 1. 72.</ls> {@--13@} A fit or worthy object; स्थाने खलु सज्जति दृष्टिः <ls>M. 1</ls>; see स्थाने also. {@--14@} The place or organ of utterance of any letter, (these are eight: --अष्टौ स्थानानि वर्णानामुरः कंठः शिरस्तथा . जिह्वामूलं च दंताश्च नासिकौष्ठौ च तालु च <ls>Śik. 13.</ls>). {@--15@} A holy place. {@--16@} An altar. {@--17@} Aplace in a town, square, court. {@--18@} The place or sphere assigned after death to persons according as they perform or neglect their prescribed duties. {@--19@} (In politics, war &c.) The firm attitude or bearing of troops, standing firm so as to repel a charge; <ls>Ms. 7. 190.</ls> {@--20@} A halt. {@--21@} A stationary condition, a neutral or middle state. {@--22@} That which constitutes the chief strength or the very existence of a kingdom, a stamina of a kingdom; {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} army, treasure, town, and territory; <ls>Ms. 7. 56</ls> (where <ls>Kull.</ls> renders स्थानं by दंडकोषपुरराष्ट्रात्मकं चतुर्विधं). {@--23@} Likeness, resemblance. {@--24@} Part or division of a work, section, chapter &c. {@--25@} The character or part of an actor. {@--26@} Interval, opportunity, leisure. {@--27@} (In music) A note, tone, modulation of the voice.
